title: How to Draw a Character

steps.headline: Get the supplies you will need (see Things You'll Need).
Draw the head.
steps.description: Draw the circle - for best results, get something that's round on the bottom or top, for example, a cup. Find one that's your perfect size and draw around it.

steps.headline: Draw the eyes.
steps.description: Draw two circles, level with each other. Draw two lines in the middle of each circle.

steps.headline: Draw the eyebrows.
steps.description: Draw a curved line just about 2 centimeter (0.8 in) on top of the eye. Draw lots of little lines under each eyebrow.

steps.headline: Draw the nose.
steps.description: Draw one small line in the middle of the face. Draw a smaller line attached to it (a lying down line). Draw two small dots in between the two lines

steps.headline: Draw the mouth.
steps.description: Draw about 1 centimeter (0.4 in) away from the bottom of the head, a curved line. Draw a straight line lying down on top of the curved line.

steps.headline: Add lots of squares for teeth.
Draw a semi-circle for a sticking out tongue.
Draw two lines in the middle of the mouth.
Draw the arms.
steps.description: Underneath the head, draw a bump with no line at the bottom (make sure you put it at the left side). Draw a diagonal line attached to the bump. Draw that again on the right side.

steps.headline: Draw five lines attached to the line.
steps.description: Repeat this again on the other side. Draw a line up from that and do it at the other side.

steps.headline: Draw a skirt or dress or top or shorts or trousers.
steps.description: Add any accessories, such as belts.

steps.headline: Draw any type of hair style.
Draw the legs.
steps.description: Draw two lines side by side. Draw semi-circle attached to it. Repeat on the other side and draw stuff in the background.

steps.headline: If you'd like, you can colour the character (optional).
Draw a circle or other shape, depending on what your animal is.
Draw two small circles in the middle of the other circle/shape, for the eyes.
Draw two smaller circles in the middle of the eyes.
Draw a curved line on top of each eye for the eyebrows.
Draw an L shape to make the nose.
Draw a curved smile/sad mouth under the nose.
Draw triangle or square shapes for the teeth, and a semi-circle for the tongue.
Draw half an oval under the head for the body.
Draw two rectangular shapes on either side for the arms.
Draw paws, etc., at the end of each arm.
steps.description: If you'd like, you can create fingers or add pads.

steps.headline: Draw two legs on the bottom of the body.
Draw paws, etc., under the legs, using circles.
Draw fingers or pads if you'd like.
Colour your character if desired (optional).

tyn: Crayons or anything else that can be used to colour (optional)
text: A Person Get the supplies you will need (see Things You'll Need).  Draw the head. Draw the circle - for best results, get something that's round on the bottom or top, for example, a cup. Find one that's your perfect size and draw around it. Draw the eyes. Draw two circles, level with each other. Draw two lines in the middle of each circle. Draw the eyebrows. Draw a curved line just about 2 centimeter (0.8 in) on top of the eye. Draw lots of little lines under each eyebrow. Draw the nose. Draw one small line in the middle of the face. Draw a smaller line attached to it (a lying down line). Draw two small dots in between the two lines Draw the mouth. Draw about 1 centimeter (0.4 in) away from the bottom of the head, a curved line. Draw a straight line lying down on top of the curved line. Add lots of squares for teeth.  Draw a semi-circle for a sticking out tongue.  Draw two lines in the middle of the mouth.  Draw the arms. Underneath the head, draw a bump with no line at the bottom (make sure you put it at the left side). Draw a diagonal line attached to the bump. Draw that again on the right side. Draw five lines attached to the line. Repeat this again on the other side. Draw a line up from that and do it at the other side. Draw a skirt or dress or top or shorts or trousers. Add any accessories, such as belts. Draw any type of hair style.  Draw the legs. Draw two lines side by side. Draw semi-circle attached to it. Repeat on the other side and draw stuff in the background. If you'd like, you can colour the character (optional).  An Animal Draw a circle or other shape, depending on what your animal is.  Draw two small circles in the middle of the other circle/shape, for the eyes.  Draw two smaller circles in the middle of the eyes.  Draw a curved line on top of each eye for the eyebrows.  Draw an L shape to make the nose. Draw this under the eyes. Draw a curved smile/sad mouth under the nose.  Draw triangle or square shapes for the teeth, and a semi-circle for the tongue.  Draw half an oval under the head for the body.  Draw two rectangular shapes on either side for the arms.  Draw paws, etc., at the end of each arm. If you'd like, you can create fingers or add pads. Draw two legs on the bottom of the body.  Draw paws, etc., under the legs, using circles.  Draw fingers or pads if you'd like.  Colour your character if desired (optional).
sentences: A Person Get the supplies you will need (see Things You'll Need).
Draw the head.
Draw the circle - for best results, get something that's round on the bottom or top, for example, a cup.
Find one that's your perfect size and draw around it.
Draw the eyes.
Draw two circles, level with each other.
Draw two lines in the middle of each circle.
Draw the eyebrows.
Draw a curved line just about 2 centimeter (0.8 in) on top of the eye.
Draw lots of little lines under each eyebrow.
Draw the nose.
Draw one small line in the middle of the face.
Draw a smaller line attached to it (a lying down line).
Draw two small dots in between the two lines Draw the mouth.
Draw about 1 centimeter (0.4 in) away from the bottom of the head, a curved line.
Draw a straight line lying down on top of the curved line.
Add lots of squares for teeth.
Draw a semi-circle for a sticking out tongue.
Draw two lines in the middle of the mouth.
Draw the arms.
Underneath the head, draw a bump with no line at the bottom (make sure you put it at the left side).
Draw a diagonal line attached to the bump.
Draw that again on the right side.
Draw five lines attached to the line.
Repeat this again on the other side.
Draw a line up from that and do it at the other side.
Draw a skirt or dress or top or shorts or trousers.
Add any accessories, such as belts.
Draw any type of hair style.
Draw the legs.
Draw two lines side by side.
Draw semi-circle attached to it.
Repeat on the other side and draw stuff in the background.
If you'd like, you can colour the character (optional).
An Animal Draw a circle or other shape, depending on what your animal is.
Draw two small circles in the middle of the other circle/shape, for the eyes.
Draw two smaller circles in the middle of the eyes.
Draw a curved line on top of each eye for the eyebrows.
Draw an L shape to make the nose.
Draw this under the eyes.
Draw a curved smile/sad mouth under the nose.
Draw triangle or square shapes for the teeth, and a semi-circle for the tongue.
Draw half an oval under the head for the body.
Draw two rectangular shapes on either side for the arms.
Draw paws, etc., at the end of each arm.
If you'd like, you can create fingers or add pads.
Draw two legs on the bottom of the body.
Draw paws, etc., under the legs, using circles.
Draw fingers or pads if you'd like.
Colour your character if desired (optional).
